Comment: Oh please. I‚Äôm not one to tout but my MPA is hyper focused on foreign policy and I spend a lot of time thinking about the PRC. Like a lot. If anyone has ever played Go or read Sun Tzu, China‚Äôs trade war tactics make sense. Sun Tzu teaches you to piss off your enemy without movement and aggressive posturing. The game Go is about encircling your opponent until they suffocate. That‚Äôs what the PRC did here. They let Trump make all the moves, all the mistakes, and they slowly surrounded him. Trump is used to making loud noises and an opponent backing off. The PRC has 3,000 years of history on how to use that tactic against their opponent. Trump went into a room expecting to play checkers and scream king me, China was playing Go.  I‚Äôm not sitting here saying China is awesome, I‚Äôm sitting here saying ‚Äúdo not underestimate their resolve.‚Äù Their desire for Pacific hegemony and super power status predates the PRC by half a century. They are more than willing to watch a nation trip over itself to achieve their goals.
